intro: Aphanes pentamera, commonly known as the five-rayed sandmat, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often resembling a star shape. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Aphanes pentamera is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
